    • Method Detail

      • createAccountTable

        public void createAccountTable()
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates the account table on the database if it does not exist. The bank account will be added after creation of the table.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • addAccount

        public void addAccount(java.lang.String accountNumber,
                       java.lang.String owner,
                       java.math.BigDecimal startBalance)
                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Adds an account with an owner and a start balance to the database table "Account". The start balance will be provided from the bank account.
        Parameters:
        accountNumber - specifies the account.
        owner - the person owning the account.
        startBalance - the amount of money which will be transferred to the account immediately after creation.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • getAccountByNumber

        public Account getAccountByNumber(java.lang.String number,
                                  boolean attachTransactions)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns an account object belonging to the given number.
        Parameters:
        number - specifies the account.
        attachTransactions - if this is true, the transaction history for this account is attached to the account object.
        Returns:
        the account object
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • getAccounts

        public java.util.List<Account> getAccounts()
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
        Every account existing on the account database table is put into a list. The list is returned.
        Returns:
        list containing account objects.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • updateOwner

        public void updateOwner(java.lang.String number,
                        java.lang.String owner)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Replaces the current owner name of an account in the database by a new name.
        Parameters:
        number - specifies the account.
        owner - the new owner name.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • getFreeNumber

        public java.lang.String getFreeNumber()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        The next free number for an account is determined, reserved and returned.
        Returns:
        if the bank account does not exist yet, the number returned is 0000. Otherwise it is a number between 1000 and 9999, which does not belong to an existing account. If there is no more free number, an empty string will be returned.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.

      • numberExists

        public boolean numberExists(java.lang.String number)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks if a number is the account number of an existing account.
        Parameters:
        number - account number belonging to the account which is to be checked.
        Returns:
        true, if there is an account with this number and false, if there is no account belonging to this number.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database access fails or the sql statement cannot be executed.
